TopicTitle: Stayputnik with launch system. (Now with download link!)

Articles.Content:
It currently orbits Kerbin at an altitude of 110KM.

May we never forget the day we set course for the stars.

Reply with what you think!

And a lovely view of the city lights.

Thank you nathankell for making your awesome rescale!

Craft file/download link: http://www./download/ck4d47yuuz1c4bb/Stayputnik+1.craft

Required mods (Please warn me if I missed one): Mechjeb2, KW rocketry, RLA stockalike, Ferram aerospace (Might work without), Recommended for use with 10X Kerbol system (Alternate CFG for R.S.S.), stretchySRBs, Procedural fairings, stock expansion pack, and the lack luster labs stockalike.

Once again, please warn me if I missed a mod.

This is not a 100% accurate rebuild of the sputnik, but you can if you like modify it to be more or less the same.

Please do not redistribute the craft file.

Licence: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/2.5/ca/

Edited April 13, 2014 by WindShieIds

The sputnik launcher was a R7 without upper stage the sputnik was directly attached to the central booster (they even added reflective surfaces on the core booster, so it could be seen much more easily from the ground) - both the sputnik and the core stage orbited earth until the orbit decayed

The sputnik launcher was a R7 without upper stage the sputnik was directly attached to the central booster (they even added reflective surfaces on the core booster, so it could be seen much more easily from the ground) - both the sputnik and the core stage orbited earth until the orbit decayed

That's pretty hard to engineer with 10X Kerbol stock, so I had to improvise a bit.

Any possibility of a sharing the craft file?

I really like the look and I'd like to play with it some.

Any possibility of a sharing the craft file?

I really like the look and I'd like to play with it some.

Er...I'll look into mediafire but I can't gaurauntee anything, plus there's no way I can list all the mods used in this stuff.

That's cool, I understand... Thanks!
